comments.body: If this is confusing, it is because `V` is interpreted as the *unsized* void (or void DType) and not `V0` here.  You can't use an actual `V0` here, but if you could the result would be same-kind.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +150,154 @@        # Unstructured void to unstructured is actually no cast at all:
        assert np.can_cast("V3", "V", casting="no")
        assert np.can_cast("V0", "V", casting="no")
